title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. Steps To Reproduce:
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shutdown/reboot the computer.

Expected Behavior:
A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.

Observed Behavior:
There is no warning or question message box displayed, and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately without allowing users to save their changes.

Note: This issue may also affect other Windows programs like Word and Outlook.
